procedures.outcome: Diagnosis confirmed as non-small cell lung carcinoma

note.text: Procedure was well-tolerated. Tissue samples sent for histopathological analysis.
CT scan performed without complications. No new lesions detected.
Patient underwent lobectomy without complications. Post-operative recovery is progressing well.

code.display: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease with (acute) exacerbation

diagnosis.notes: Patient presented with acute shortness of breath and was diagnosed with COPD exacerbation.

code.display: Malignant neoplasm of upper lobe, bronchus or lung

diagnosis.notes: Biopsy confirmed Stage II Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer.
Diagnosed during routine check-up. Managed with ACE inhibitors.
Screened positive during hospitalization. Started on Metformin.

allergies.notes: Develops rash upon administration of penicillin.
Severe allergic reaction to latex gloves used during surgery.

sections.text: Persistent cough and chest pain.
Stage II Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer.
Schedule for biopsy and initiate treatment protocol.

notes.generatedtext: Patient presents with persistent cough and chest pain. Imaging suggests a mass in the upper lobe of the lung. Biopsy scheduled for further evaluation.

sections.text: Malignant cells consistent with non-small cell carcinoma.
Diagnosis confirmed as Stage II Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer.

notes.generatedtext: The biopsy reveals malignant cells indicative of non-small cell carcinoma. No evidence of metastasis at this stage.

sections.text: Surgery followed by chemotherapy.
Proceed with lobectomy to remove affected lung tissue.

notes.generatedtext: After evaluating the patient's condition, it is recommended to proceed with a lobectomy followed by chemotherapy to ensure comprehensive treatment.

sections.text: Chest CT shows no new metastasis.
Patient shows positive response to chemotherapy.

notes.generatedtext: Recent chest CT indicates no new metastatic lesions. The patient is responding well to the current chemotherapy regimen.

sections.text: Lobectomy performed successfully.
Continue chemotherapy and monitor recovery.

notes.generatedtext: The patient underwent a successful lobectomy with no intraoperative complications. Post-operative recovery is progressing as expected.

sections.text: Patient reports no significant symptoms.
Continue maintenance therapy and schedule next follow-up.

notes.generatedtext: The patient is currently asymptomatic and tolerating maintenance therapy well. Next follow-up scheduled in three months.

note.text: Patient tolerated the procedure well. No immediate complications observed.
Patient experienced mild discomfort during the procedure.

code.display: Malignant neoplasm of unspecified site of left female breast

diagnosis.notes: Diagnosed with stage II breast cancer following biopsy and imaging studies.
Patient has a history of hypertension, controlled with medication.
Diagnosed during routine check-up; HbA1c levels indicate controlled diabetes.

labs.value: Hemoglobin: 13.5 g/dL, WBC: 6.2 x10^9/L, Platelets: 250 x10^9/L
labs.referenceRange: Hemoglobin: 12-16 g/dL, WBC: 4-11 x10^9/L, Platelets: 150-450 x10^9/L

allergies.notes: Patient developed a mild rash after taking amoxicillin.

sections.text: Stage II Malignant neoplasm of left breast
Schedule lumpectomy and initiate chemo protocol.

notes.generatedtext: Patient presents with a palpable mass in the L breast. Mammogram and ultrasound confirm a 2.5 cm spiculated lesion. Biopsy results indicate invasive ductal carcinoma, ER+/PR+/HER2-. No distant mets on CT chest/abdomen/pelvis. ECOG performance status 1. Recommended lumpectomy followed by adjuvant chemotherapy. Discussed potential side effects and treatment timeline with patient.

sections.text: Lumpectomy performed on left breast.
Tumor size 2.5 cm with clear margins.
Begin chemotherapy as scheduled.

notes.generatedtext: The patient underwent a successful lumpectomy of the left breast under GA. Intraoperative findings reveal a 2.5 cm invasive ductal carcinoma with no lymphovascular invasion. Margins are clear, confirmed by frozen section. Sentinel lymph node biopsy performed; results pending. Estimated blood loss 50 mL. Patient tolerated the procedure well. Post-operative instructions provided. Plan to start adjuvant chemo next week.

sections.text: Second cycle of chemotherapy administered.
Patient tolerated the session well with no adverse effects.
Continue with the planned chemotherapy regimen.

notes.generatedtext: Karen Wee received her second cycle of AC (Doxorubicin and Cyclophosphamide) chemo today. Vital signs stable throughout the infusion. No episodes of febrile neutropenia, nausea, or vomiting reported. CBC prior to session: WBC 6.2 x10^9/L, Hgb 13.5 g/dL, Plt 250 x10^9/L. Anti-emetics administered as per protocol. Patient educated on potential delayed side effects and to report any unusual symptoms immediately. Next cycle scheduled in 3 weeks.

sections.text: Chest X-ray performed.
No acute abnormalities detected.
Normal chest X-ray.

notes.generatedtext: PA and lateral views of the chest were obtained. Lungs are clear bilaterally with no evidence of consolidation, effusion, or pneumothorax. Heart size within normal limits. No mediastinal widening observed. No suspicious nodules or masses identified. No bony abnormalities noted. Impression: Normal CXR. No signs of metastatic disease in the thoracic cavity.

sections.text: Reviewed HbA1c levels and blood glucose control.
Type 2 Diabetes mellitus is well-controlled with current medication.
Continue Metformin. Schedule next HbA1c test in six months.

notes.generatedtext: Patient presents for routine follow-up of T2DM. HbA1c today is 7.2%, down from 8.0% six months ago. Fasting BG levels consistently within target range. No hypoglycemic episodes reported. No signs of diabetic retinopathy or nephropathy on recent screening. Advised to maintain current diet and exercise regimen. Continue Metformin 500 mg BID. Next HbA1c scheduled for March 2024. Discussed importance of adherence to medication and lifestyle modifications.
